intro: Phlomoides isochila, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically blue or violet, clustered in dense whorls along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
